Winter Travels Recap

Well, that's it for my posts on my travels during the winter. I thought it'd be nice to visually see where all I've traveled in China, so I used a red marker to mark up my China map:


Almost all of that is from my travels this winter, the exception being my travels to Dalian and Chang Bai Shan back in October and my visit to Tai Shan and Qufu in Shangdong province this last weekend.

In case you missed any of my posts about my winter travels, here's the full list:
  • Traveling with Josh, Chad and Krystal:
    • My Winter Travels, Part 1: Harbin (Photo Album)
  • Traveling with Jon, Drew, Da Yu and Liu Kai:
    • My Winter Travels, Part 2: Hainan (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 3: Guilin (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 4: Yangshuo (Photo Album)
  • Visiting my cousin Tim in Japan:
    • My Winter Travels, Part 5: Sendai (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 6: Yamadera (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 7: Matsushima (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 8: Tokyo (Photo Album)
  • Traveling with my parents and Allen:
    • My Winter Travels, Part 9: Shanghai (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 10: Zhujiajiao (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 11: Suzhou (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 12: Hangzhou (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 13: Huang Shan (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 14: Beijing (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 15: Xi'an (Photo Album)
    • My Winter Travels, Part 16: Beijing, Again (Photo Album)

About

Well, I'm back in Qinhuangdao from Hong Kong and Taiwan. My time in Hong Kong and Taiwan was enjoyable, but not very eventful. I've got more about my time in China that I plan to blog about, but recently I've focused all my computer time on finishing a project that I'll be putting on my resume for when I apply for jobs. So blogging just isn't a priority right now.

The Olympics don't officially start until tomorrow night, but some of the events have already began. I went to the USA vs. Norway women's soccer game last night. Unfortunately, we lost 2-0, but it was fun to go. I'll be going to 3 different events in Beijing before flying home in 6 days!
